a comment stating the current directory and the resulting target would be good.

nodes.bodyText:
We already embed youtube videos for guided tours.
e.g. here https://artemis.ase.in.tum.de/#/courses/39/exercises (start tutorial)
We simply use an iframe for this: guided-tour.component.html:111.
The URLs are defined here: guidedTourCourseExerciseOverview.json:11
But this produces the same error as the official youtube component which is just an abstraction above the iframe?
And I like the interactivity I gain from using the component for example stopping the video when the unit is closed.

So I have a version working without using the youtube i frame api and thus without using the angular youtube component. What is lost? It is not possible in any way to interact with the video using code, meaning it is not possible for example to pause the video when the unit is collapsed. Through a "hack" by reassigning the src attribute of the iframe you can make it that the video stops completely when the unit is collapsed. The problem with this is that the viewing progress is lost. There is also no feedback from the video anymore, thus no error messages can be displayed.

I removed the YouTube Angular Component and YouTube I Frame APi in cda468f in favor of using a simple iframe approach. Some features are lost:
Videos now continue playing even though video unit is collapsed.
YouTube Errors are not received and not displayed in the Ui any more
@krusche what do you think. Most importantly we should have a consistent way of embedding youtube videos throughout the platform.

I think we use the easy version for now, we can still discuss improvements in a follow-up.
I would also favor consistency. Let's have a quick discussion tomorrow and check whether we should use the YouTube Angular Component for the other place as well.
By the way: not everyone is using Youtube, so we should also allow other videos to be embedded in lectures ;-)
please remove the unused entry for now here
Let's stay consistent with the REST URLs

I did it this way because I tried to follow the guidelines:

Should I change it for all units?
I do not fully agree to the marked statement and would prefer, that our REST URLs stay consistent of starting points
so yes, please change it ;-)

nodes.bodyText:
with this approach, we cannot support any other streaming platform. I don't think we should do that. I think it would be better to allow users to enter the whole URL and store it in the database instead.
We could still have a special handling for Youtube URLs here, but we should not have a vendor lock-in!
Ok I will switch it to storing the whole URL in the database instead of just the id.
